text.section:
A person is guilty of bribing a witness when he offers, confers or agrees to confer any pecuniary benefit upon a witness or a person he believes may be called as a witness in any official proceeding with intent to:
Influence the testimony of that person; or
Induce that person to avoid legal process summoning him to testify; or
Induce that person to absent himself from an official proceeding to which he has been legally summoned.
Bribing a witness is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 201, effective January 1, 1975.
